demographics.name: Patricia Rodriguez
demographics.supportServices: Nutrition consult placed due to esophagitis risk; Social work consult offered for coping support.

diagnosis.relevantHistory: 40 pack-year smoking history (quit 5 years prior to diagnosis).
diagnosis.reasonForProtonTherapy: Locally advanced disease requiring concurrent chemoradiation. Protons considered to minimize dose to heart and contralateral lung due to tumor location and borderline PFTs.

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) with Concurrent Chemotherapy
treatmentPlan.techniqueSummary: Intensity-Modulated Proton Therapy (IMPT) / Pencil Beam Scanning

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in custom BodyFix mold with arms up. Abdominal compression belt applied. Respiratory gating utilized. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: 4D CT acquired for proton therapy planning with respiratory gating assessment. Fused with PET/CT for target delineation.

dosimetry.constraints: Spinal Cord Max < 50 Gy(RBE); Heart Mean < 15 Gy(RBE); Total Lung V20 < 25%
dosimetry.planNotes: Proton therapy for lung to spare OARs, particularly heart and contralateral lung, due to borderline PFTs.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily IGRT confirmed target alignment within tolerance. Gating system active.
fractions.sideEffects: Mild fatigue. Grade 1 esophagitis managed with diet and medication.
fractions.notes: Patient tolerating concurrent chemo and proton therapy well.

imagingAndReports.summary: 3.0 cm RUL mass abutting mediastinum. R hilar and mediastinal lymphadenopathy.

reportDetails.findings: A 3.0 cm speculated mass is identified in the posterior segment of the right upper lobe, abutting the major fissure and adjacent mediastinal pleura. Enlarged right hilar (Station 10R) and paratracheal (Station 4R) lymph nodes are noted, measuring up to 1.5 cm in short axis. Minor adjacent atelectasis.
reportDetails.impression: Right upper lobe mass with associated hilar and mediastinal adenopathy, suspicious for primary lung malignancy with nodal involvement.

imagingAndReports.summary: FDG-avid RUL mass (SUV max 12) and mediastinal nodes (SUV max 8). No distant mets.

reportDetails.findings: Intense FDG uptake within the known right upper lobe mass (SUV max 12.0). Moderately intense FDG uptake within right hilar (Station 10R, SUV max 7.5) and right paratracheal (Station 4R, SUV max 8.0) lymph nodes. No other suspicious FDG avid foci identified in the chest, abdomen, or pelvis to suggest distant metastatic disease.
reportDetails.impression: Hypermetabolic right upper lobe mass and associated hilar/mediastinal lymph nodes consistent with malignancy (Stage IIIA). No evidence of distant metastases.

reportDetails.microscopicDescription: Sections show fragments of bronchial mucosa infiltrated by malignant glands lined by atypical columnar cells with enlarged, hyperchromatic nuclei and prominent nucleoli. Immunohistochemical stains show positivity for TTF-1 and Napsin-A, supporting lung origin.
reportDetails.comment: Findings consistent with primary lung adenocarcinoma.

imagingAndReports.summary: FEV1 65% predicted, DLCO 60% predicted. Moderate impairment.

reportDetails.impression: Moderate obstructive defect with reduced diffusing capacity. Findings suggest moderate underlying lung disease limiting pulmonary reserve.

imagingAndReports.summary: 4D CT acquired for proton therapy planning with respiratory gating assessment.

reportDetails.procedure: 4D CT simulation for proton therapy of thorax.
reportDetails.setup: Patient positioned supine in custom BodyFix mold with arms up. Abdominal compression belt applied to limit diaphragmatic excursion.
reportDetails.scanParams: 4D CT dataset acquired covering entire thorax, synchronized with respiratory cycle (Varian RPM system). Multiple respiratory phases reconstructed (e.g., 0%, 50% inhale, AvgIP).
reportDetails.fusion: Diagnostic PET/CT (02/01/2025) fused with average intensity projection (AvgIP) CT dataset for target delineation.
reportDetails.notes: Patient tolerated procedure and compression well. Respiratory motion assessed for ITV generation/gating strategy. Data sent for IMPT planning.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Michael Chen (Med Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt with Stage IIIA NSCLC AdenoCa, referred for definitive chemoradiation. Reviewed PFTs show moderate impairment. Discussed standard chemoRT (Carbo/Taxol + Photons). Given location and PFTs, will refer to Rad Onc to discuss potential benefit of proton therapy for OAR sparing.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Jane Wilson (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ Stage IIIA NSCLC, borderline PFTs. Reviewed case. Comparative photon vs proton plan requested. Proton plan shows significant reduction in mean heart dose and contralateral lung dose. Discussed potential benefits (reduced cardiac/pulm tox) and risks/logistics of proton therapy. Pt wishes to proceed with IMPT + concurrent Carbo/Taxol. 4D sim scheduled.

progressNotes.author: Physics/Dosimetry
progressNotes.summary: IMPT plan using pencil beam scanning finalized. Meets target coverage goals (60Gy/30fx) and OAR constraints (heart, lungs, esophagus, cord). Respiratory gating parameters set. Plan approved.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Jane Wilson (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 10/30 fx. Tolerating concurrent chemo/RT. Reports mild fatigue, Grade 1 esophagitis (manageable with diet/meds). No significant cough/SOB. Daily IGRT consistent. Continue plan.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Definitive (curative) treatment with concurrent chemoradiation, using proton therapy to minimize dose to the heart and healthy lung tissue.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Acute: Fatigue, esophagitis (difficulty/pain swallowing), skin reaction in treatment area, nausea/vomiting and low blood counts from chemotherapy. Late: Risk of radiation pneumonitis (lung inflammation), cardiac effects, and esophageal stricture. Explained rationale for protons to reduce these risks.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Reporting fever, uncontrolled nausea/vomiting, severe pain with swallowing, or worsening shortness of breath.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT and weekly chemotherapy. Report symptoms promptly. Maintain nutrition and hydration.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Adherence to chemotherapy schedule and supportive medications (anti-nausea, esophagitis meds).
